body.p: Installation packages are supplied in compressed archives. Ensure you have installed a suitable archive extraction utility with which to extract the archive. The MD5 sum is available at the Download page the Download page for every archive. You should check the MD5 sum of the downloaded archive with an MD5 checking tool available on your platform.This does not appear to be true of all platforms. The Windows installer is an EXE. The Linux is a shell script. And I'm pretty sure most platforms come with support for the typical archive formats used on them built in, so I am not sure that this needs saying. If a reader downloaded a .zip file and did not know what to do with it, however, this topic does not give them enough information to figure it out. So this topic should either go away or be expanded.
